verb.description: Assume as a fact; put forward as a basis of argument.
examples: the Confucian view posits a perfectible human nature
he posited that the world economy is a system with its own particular equilibrium
the Professor posits Cohen in his second category of poets

noun.description: A statement which is made on the assumption that it will prove to be true.

origin: Mid 17th century: from Latin posit- placed, from the verb ponere.
